subject: Physical Fitness
title: PNF Stretching
description: A micro-lesson that makes PNF Stretching usable.

hook.text: A physical therapist stretches your hamstring, asks you to push against her hand, then stretches further. Why?

buildup.text: PNF â€” proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation â€” uses contract-relax cycles to trick the nervous system.

discovery.text: After a strong contraction, your nervous system briefly lowers its guard. The muscle relaxes more deeply.

twist.text: PNF produces faster flexibility gains than static stretching alone â€” sometimes in a single session.

climax.text: It requires a partner or prop and should be done carefully. Overzealous PNF can strain muscles.

punchline.text: Contract, relax, stretch further. Your nervous system falls for it every time.

quiz.question: How does PNF stretching achieve greater range?
options: Contracting then relaxing tricks the nervous system into allowing more stretch
